articles.title: Kim Jong Un Makes Congratulatory Speech at Joint Meeting of KCU Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Makes Congratulatory Speech at Joint Meeting of KCU Organizations
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission, made a congratulatory speech at the joint national meeting of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) organizations.
					 He in his speech warmly congratulated the delegates and all other members of the KCU across the country on the anniversary being marked amid great care and blessings of the party and the people.
					
					 He also extended a warm salute to their teachers and parents across the country working hard to bring them up stoutly.
					
					 He said that June 6 is not only the holiday for the KCU but a significant one for the WPK and all the people.
					
					 There are in the world no such schoolchildren as those in the DPRK, millions in all, reliably growing to be pillars of future, rallied close around one and the same organization with red ties around their necks, he noted, adding: 
					
					 For the WPK and the DPRK, the beloved KCU members are treasures more precious than a hundred million tons of gold and silver as they represent hope and future.
					
					 Admirable KCU members have done a lot of good things for the country and people, he noted, and continued:
					
					 The party and people regard it as great pleasure and pride to have such excellent KCU. The future of Songun Korea is very bright and rosy as it has such ranks of millions of juvenile revolutionaries.
					
					 The KCU is demonstrating before the world its honor as a mighty organization of successors to the revolution as now thanks to the benevolent care of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il possessed of the noblest love for the younger generation and future as their natural disposition.
					
					 There were no such great fathers in the world as the Generalissimos who put forward the children as kings of the country and devoted everything to the schoolchildren all their lives, regarding it as the most important affairs of the party and state to show love for the younger generation.
					
					 It is the intention of the WPK to build the best thriving socialist nation and hand it over to the KCU members, he said, stressing that thriving Korea in the future will be the strongest country in the world in which happy laughter will be heard from every house and all people live in harmony.
					
					 He called on the KCU members to uphold this great country and build it more wonderfully, indicating the following tasks:
					
					 The KCU members should learn from the glorious childhood of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and reliably carry forward the lifeblood of the revolution holding aloft the flag of KCU after the flag of the immortal sun, always cherishing the trust and benevolence of the Generalissimos.
					
					 They also should become genuine juvenile revolutionaries and guards in the era of Songun who safeguard the party like the heroes of the Anti-Japanese Children's Corps and juvenile guerillas during the Fatherland Liberation War and advance along the way indicated by the party.
					
					 They should prepare themselves to be able revolutionary talents and pillars of a prosperous Korea who are knowledgeable, virtuous and healthy.
					
					 It is necessary for them not to waste even spare time but work harder upholding the banner of learning for thriving Korea.
					
					 They should become exemplary members of the union who not only study hard but observe the socialist morality, always love the organization, collective and comrades, respect teachers and elders, have good hand in sports and do good things for the country. 
					
					 They should remember that the honor of being party members and winning the gold medal of heroes starts from the red ties and badges of the union and voluntarily take part in its organizational life.
					
					 The party puts great trust in the instructors of the union organizations and instructors of sub-branches of the union, said Kim Jong Un, expressing expectation that they would become genuine teachers who take good care of and love the KCU members as their real parents would do and lead them to bring their talent into bloom.
					
					 Kim Jong Un said that the party and government of the DPRK will make it a priority of their affairs to bring up children, carrying forward noble love of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for rising generation, and make every possible effort to rear the beloved KCU members to be the pillars of Songun Korea who are the happiest and excellent in the world.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Sympathy to Nigerian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Message of Sympathy to Nigerian President
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Wednesday sent a message of sympathy to Goodluck Ebele Jonathan, president of Nigeria, in connection with a plane crash in Nigeria that claimed heavy casualties. 
					 Kim in the message expressed deep sympathy and consolation to the president and, through him, to the victims and their bereaved families.

articles.title: Condolatory Visit Paid to Nigerian Embassy
articles.content:
Condolatory Visit Paid to Nigerian Embassy
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Officials of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Foreign Trade, the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the General Bureau of Diplomatic Corps Affairs of the DPRK paid a condolatory visit to the Nigerian embassy here on Wednesday in connection with a plane crash that claimed huge human losses in Nigeria.
					 The visitors signed condolence book.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Visits Mangyongdae
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the All-China Women's Federation headed by Zhen Yan, vice-chairwoman and member of the Secretariat, visited Mangyongdae, the birthplace of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The members of the delegation laid bouquets at the old home of Kim Il Sung at Mangyongdae in deep reverence.
					
					 They looked round historic relics preserved there with care, being briefed on the glorious revolutionary history of Kim Il Sung and his family.
					
					 They visited the revolutionary historic relics on Mangyong Hill after posing for a souvenir picture in front of the President's old home.
					
					 After the visit the head said that Kim Il Sung liberated the country and devoted all his life to the country and people. His great exploits will shine forever, she added.
					
					 After looking round the Hana Music Information Center, a comprehensive art information center, she said that she could know better about the efforts exerted by leader Kim Jong Il for the people till the last moment of his life.
					
					 The delegation also visited e-library at Kim Il Sung University, Pyongyang Hosiery Factory, the U.S. armed spy ship "Pueblo" displayed here, etc.

articles.title: Chinese Delegation Lays Wreath before Friendship Tower
articles.content:
Chinese Delegation Lays Wreath before Friendship Tower
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The visiting delegation of the All-China Women's Federation led by Zhen Yan, vice-chairwoman and member of the Secretariat of the Federation, laid a wreath before the Friendship Tower here on Wednesday.
					 The wreath was laid in the name of the delegation.
					
					 The visitors observed a moment's silence to the memory of the fallen fighters of the Chinese People's Volunteers who bravely fought in the Korean War against the invasion by the U.S. imperialists.

articles.title: Cambodian Guests Visit Tower of Juche Idea
articles.content:
Cambodian Guests Visit Tower of Juche Idea
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Hor Nam Hong, deputy prime minister and minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Cambodia, and his party visited the Tower of the Juche Idea on Wednesday.
					 Being briefed on the grand monument, the guests looked round the tower and group sculptures.
					
					 They enjoyed a bird's-eye view of Pyongyang from the top of the tower.

articles.title: Cambodian Guests Leave for Home
articles.content:
Cambodian Guests Leave for Home
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Hor Nam Hong, deputy prime minister and minister of Foreign Affairs and International Cooperation of Cambodia, and his party left for home on Wednesday.

articles.title: Vice President and His Party Arrive
articles.content:
AP Vice President and His Party Arrive
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- John Daniszewski, vice president of the Associated Press of the U.S., and his party arrived here by air Wednesday.

articles.title: KCU Delegates Sorely Miss Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
KCU Delegates Sorely Miss Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Yearning for President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il have become more intensive among delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU).
					 Jo Kuk (12), a delegate from Woeryong Secondary School in Kanggye City, Jagang Province, told KCNA:
					
					 "I have come to Pyongyang with 150 000 white broad bellflower roots from my native place to plant them around the Kumsusan Palace of the Sun where Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il lie in state.
					
					 My native place is associated with leadership exploits of the peerlessly great men.
					
					 I want to plant them marked with sincerity of my parents and classmates."
					
					 Pak Tae Hyok, a delegate from Hoeryong Primary School in Hoeryong City, North Hamgyong Province, said:
					
					 "I am here with 40 kilograms of wild honey, gathered together with my classmates, and white broad bellflower and lily bell roots.
					
					 They represent our unanimous wish for good health of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 I will be a pillar of the future as befitting the rising generation of Hoeryong where anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk was born."
					
					 Many other delegates, including Ri Jong Sim, a delegate from Ryangji Secondary School in Songwon County, Jagang Province, brought with themselves saplings of various species of trees, wild vegetables, gravel stones and congratulatory banners.

articles.title: Joint National Meeting of KCU Organizations Held
articles.content:
Joint National Meeting of KCU Organizations Held
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- A joint national meeting of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) organizations took place with splendor at Kim Il Sung Stadium in Pyongyang Wednesday to celebrate its 66th anniversary.
					 Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, was present at the meeting.
					
					 A KCU member presented a bouquet to Kim Jong Un and another member tied a red neckerchief around his neck.
					
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae and Ri Yong Ho, members of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C, the WPK.
					
					 Also present there were Kim Kyong Hui, Jang Song Thaek, Kim Ki Nam, Choe Thae Bok, Ri Myong Su, Mun Kyong Dok, officials of working people's organizations, officials concerned, delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the KCU and schoolchildren in Pyongyang,
					
					 Present there on invitation were war veterans, persons of merits and parents of schoolchildren.
					
					 Kim Jong Un made a congratulatory speech.
					
					 A congratulatory group of the KCU recited a poem for the occasion.
					
					 Led by Jon Yong Nam, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, schoolchildren expressed their determination to fully prepare themselves as the children's guard intensely loyal to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 After schoolchildren sang in chorus song "Forward, Keeping in the Footsteps of Kim Jong Un" to the accompaniment of the band music, schoolchildren made a march-past, led by open cars carrying banners of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 As the meeting was over, all the participants broke into cheers of "Hurrah!"
					
					 Kim Jong Un acknowledged the enthusiastic cheers of the schoolchildren.

articles.title: Concert Given by Unhasu Orchestra on KCU Anniversary
articles.content:
Concert Given by Unhasu Orchestra on KCU Anniversary
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- A concert "Love the Future" was given by the Unhasu Orchestra here on Wednesday, the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU).
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un appeared in the auditorium together with exemplary members of KCU.
					
					 He congratulated the KCU delegates to the celebrations of its anniversary and extended warm greetings to them.
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae, Ri Yong Ho and other senior party, state and army officials and officials of the party and armed forces organs and the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League and the KCU delegates.
					
					 The concert began with the playing of the national anthem. Its repertoire included mixed sextet and chorus "You Are the Future of the Country", male solo and chorus "The Path Leading to Mt. Paektu", chorus "We Live under the Embrace of the Leader" and female solo and chorus "Warm Is Love of the Country."
					
					 The performers sang high praises of the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who provided and glorified the glorious tradition of the Juche-based children's movement with their noble outlook on the rising generation and recorded an epic of love in which the children enjoy all blessings as the kings of the country.
					
					 Put on the stage were female trio and juvenile chorus of immortal masterpiece "Song of Korea", female solo and juvenile chorus "Where Do You Come Up to", juvenile chorus "Song of Children's Guerrilla", female trio "The General's Love" and female chorus and chorus "Our Father." The peculiar numbers presented by artistes of the Unhasu Orchestra and schoolchildren stirred up the atmosphere of the concert.
					
					 The concert reached its climax when they staged its epilogue juvenile chorus "Let's Learn for Korea", poem and song "Love the Future" and chorus "March of Children's Union."  
					
					 As the concert was over, Kim Jong Un waved to the performers and audience and congratulated the performers on their successful performance.
					
					 The concert instilled into the whole audience the iron faith that the future of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il's Korea will always be bright and rosy under the leadership of Kim Jong Un, who is carving out a new history of attaching importance to the younger generation with the sunrays.

articles.title: Priority Given to KCU Delegates in Road Traffic
articles.content:
Priority Given to KCU Delegates in Road Traffic
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang citizens can witness on the city's roads processions of buses with children aboard. The children are delegates to the celebrations of the 66th birthday of the Korean Children's Union.
					 The processions are seen running non-stop at crossroads, with guide cars and motorcycles in the van making sirens.
					
					 Traffic men stand alert at the crossroads to give preferential green light to the processions.
					
					 Other vehicles slow down their speed or stop running, while passersby wave their hands to the processions.

articles.title: KCU Delegates Deeply Moved by Doctors' Care
articles.content:
KCU Delegates Deeply Moved by Doctors' Care
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Medical workers of Pyongyang are looking after delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) in a responsible manner.
					 Han So Yon (9), a delegate from Taehung Primary School in Huichon City, Jagang Province, told KCNA:
					
					 "I am grateful to doctors for caring for my health just like my own parents.
					
					 One day, I had a splitting headache, with my body shivering. I cried quietly in bed for fear that other roommates would wake.
					
					 I thought of my mother. At that time, a doctor carefully touched me on the shoulder, kindly asking what troubled me.
					
					 She took me on her back to a treatment room and measured my temperature. She then administered a medicine to me. She sat up all night for me. The doctor reminded me of my own mother." 
					
					 Ri Hak Min (12) and Choe Jin Hyang (9), delegates from Chongryong Secondary School in Pongsan County, North Hwanghae Province and from Hungnam Primary School in Hungnam District, Hamhung City, South Hamgyong Province, said that they were deeply moved by doctors' utmost care for their health.
					
					 Jang Kil San, a department director of the Ministry of Public Health, said:
					
					 "Many medical workers have been mobilized for the celebrations.
					
					 Treatment rooms fully equipped with medical apparatuses were available on each floor of each block.
					
					 First-aid treatment teams consisting of able doctors and nurses are accompanying the delegates, divided in ten ambulances.
					
					 Some delegates got operations for acute appendicitis, while some others were completely recovered from cold."

articles.title: Korean Schoolchildren in Ecstasy of Joy
articles.content:
Korean Schoolchildren in Ecstasy of Joy
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- A joint national meeting of the Korean Children's Union organizations was held with splendor at Kim Il Sung Stadium here on Wednesday to celebrate the 66th KCU anniversary in the presence of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					 All the KCU members throughout the country are now put into tumult of joy.
					
					 Hwangbo Song (13), a delegate from Kaesong Municipality, told KCNA:
					
					 "I will never forget this holiday event held in presence of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Tears rolled down from my eyes when I was looking up to him in the rostrum. He reminds me of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il, who devoted all their life to us, children.
					
					 All of the delegates wept to see him." 
					
					 Ko Hu Hoe (12), a delegate from Jagang Province, said in excitement:
					
					 "I am enjoying the KCU holiday significantly and proudly. 
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il always found himself among servicepersons in frontline military units to safeguard the happiness of us children.
					
					 And, now the dear respected Kim Jong Un personally attended the meeting to mark the KCU holiday, the first since the demise of Kim Jong Il, to congratulate us on the holiday."
					
					 Kim Se Myong (12), a student of Saesallim Secondary School in Pyongyang, said:
					
					 "Though I am not a KCU delegate, I was present at the joint national meeting of the KCU organizations. I will never forget this day for life.
					
					 Always cherishing in my mind the dear respected Kim Jong Un's loving care, I will prepare myself to become a juvenile guard and a doctor faithful to him who is identical to Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The dear respected Kim Jong Un, please accept my highest consideration. I wish you good health."

articles.title: KCU Delegates Write Diaries
articles.content:
KCU Delegates Write Diaries
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) have recorded in their diaries what they saw and did during their stay in Pyongyang.
					 KCNA had a chance to witness a few diaries at their lodging place.
					
					 Jong Hyon Gyong (13), a delegate from Ohwa Islet branch under Sunwi Secondary School in Kangryong County, South Hwanghae Province, wrote:
					
					 "Today we went to the Kaeson Youth Funfair, which I saw only on TV. I enjoyed myself in swing revolver and swing boat to my heart's content.
					
					 I had lots of photos taken there to show them to my parents, teacher and fellow islanders, who were very pleased with my visit to Pyongyang.
					
					 Wherever we go, Pyongyang citizens welcome us, waving their hands.
					
					 I will study harder to repay the loving care shown by the dear respected Kim Jong Un." 
					
					 Ri Jong (12), a delegate from Hadonggu branch under Hwangchol Secondary School in Kim Jong Suk County, Ryanggang Province, wrote:
					
					 "Since I arrived in Pyongyang by a special plane, days and nights have passed like in a dream.
					
					 A cook at Pyongyang Noodle Restaurant held me in his arms to go to the table, calling us kings of the country. Warm hospitality accorded to us wherever we go reminds me of my home villagers and classmates.
					
					 I wonder what will happen tomorrow."

articles.title: Korean Children Blessed with Rosy Future
articles.content:
Korean Children Blessed with Rosy Future
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The dear respected Kim Jong Un attended the joint national meeting of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) organizations held on Wednesday to celebrate the 66th KCU anniversary and made a congratulatory speech for the children.
					 Teachers and students of Samhung Secondary School in Pyongyang have got excited at his speech.
					
					 Kim Wi Il (12), a pupil of the school, told KCNA:
					
					 "When the dear respected Kim Jong Un made a congratulatory speech, with a broad smile on his face, I felt great excitement. His speech touched me so much.
					
					 I will prepare myself to be an able man and pillar of prosperous Korea, true to the teachings of Kim Jong Un, who takes warm care of all of us."
					
					 Another pupil Kim Kyong Sim (12) said:
					
					 "The dear respected Kim Jong Un said that the KCU is a glorious organization founded and developed under the warm care of Generalissimos Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and to become a member of the KCU is a great honor for schoolchildren.
					
					 I'll always keep this honor in my mind and prepare myself to be an able revolutionary and a pillar of the country as wished by him.
					
					 I will study hard to become a scientist and contribute to the prosperity of the country."
					
					 Jo Yong Gol, chief KCU instructor, said: 
					
					 "The dear respected Kim Jong Un invited many KCU members as delegates to the celebrations of the 66th KCU anniversary and today blessed them with their rosy future. He is really tender-hearted father for the children.
					
					 I'll be a true educationist in the era of Songun to bring up the KCU members to be creditable successors to the cause of developing socialist Korea characterized by single-mined unity."

articles.title: Children's Camping Gains Momentum in DPRK
articles.content:
Children's Camping Gains Momentum in DPRK
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Schoolchildren's camping is now in full swing in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, with the 66th birthday of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) as an occasion. 
					 In the Pyongyang City Sokam Children's Camp, KCNA had an interview with its Director Kim Ki Bo and KCU instructor Paek Kum Chol.
					
					 Question: Please tell me how the camp is operated here.
					
					 Director: The camp organizes six-day camping in 28 terms a year, with more than 500 campers in a term.
					
					 The campers enjoy sightseeing aboard an excursion ship, boating and swimming in scenic Lake Kyonryong.
					
					 The schedule includes gatherings for introducing praiseworthy things and exchanging experience, folk games, recreation parties and sports activities.
					
					 The campers like camping-out. After making a 4 to 6 kilometer-long mountain-climbing, they begin a tented life, taking meals prepared by them.
					
					 Hundreds of campers are now staying here. They are from different schools in Pyongyang, including Pyongyang Segori Primary School in Pothonggang District.
					
					 Question: I think you, instructors, are playing a big role in organizing camping.
					
					 Instructor: We are working to diversify the camping and improve camping schedule to suit the children's mind.
					
					 We strive to train them to be dependable reserves for socialist construction, equipped with ample knowledge, high morality and healthy body.

articles.title: Rice-transplantation Wound Up on at Least 1 400 Farms
articles.content:
Rice-transplantation Wound Up on at Least 1 400 Farms
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Rice-transplantation is progressing at a final phase in major fields of the country. 
					 Rice-transplantation has been finished on at least 1 400 farms of more than 80 cities and counties across the country. 
					
					 Forerunners in this work were agricultural workers at Migok Co-op Farm in Sariwon City, Chongsan Co-op Farm in Kangso District, Tongbong Co-op Farm in Hamju County, Samjigang Co-op Farm in Jaeryong County, Sinam Co-op Farm in Ryongchon County and Unhung Co-op Farm in Thaechon County. 
					
					 The rice-transplantation has been completed in Pyongyang City, Jagang and North Hamgyong provinces.
					
					 More than 95 percent of rice-transplantation was done by machines in South Hwanghae Province. As a result, over 80 farms in Haeju City, Anak and Jaeryong counties carried out their rice-transplantation under their plans. 
					
					 Major paddy fields of farms in Jungsan, Sukchon and Mundok counties in South Phyongan Province were carpeted with rice seedlings, except for rice-seedling beds. 
					
					 Rice-transplantation came to an end on more than 300 farms in North Phyongan Province as of Wednesday. 
					
					 Hundreds of farms in North Hwanghae and South Hamgyong provinces finished rice-transplantation and the number of those successful farms is on the steady increase. 
					
					 Hoeyang, Sepho and Popdong counties in Kangwon Province finished rice-transplantation in a short span of time by putting the work on a scientific and technical basis. 
					
					 In the wake of successful completion of rice-transplantation the farms are now busy sowing seeds of other crops and manuring and cultivating rice seedlings.

articles.title: KPA Servicepersons Vow to Revenge on S. Korean Regime
articles.content:
KPA Servicepersons Vow to Revenge on S. Korean Regime
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The rat-like Lee Myung Bak group of traitors in south Korea dared defame the dignity of the DPRK supreme leadership and slander the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union, which are taking place in Pyongyang amid warm welcome of all the people.
					 In this regard the General Staff of the Korean People's Army issued an open ultimatum on Monday, touching off the servicepersons' bitter resentment toward the group.
					
					 Han Chol Chu, a KPA officer, told KCNA:
					
					 "My parent named me Chol Chu (meaning 'hard blow'), with hope that I would deal a mercilessly telling blow at such guys as rat-like Myung Bak.
					
					 Rat Pak revealed himself as 'Hitler of modern type' for his madness.
					
					 This rat surpasses Hitler in fascism, bellicosity and insanity.
					
					 True to my parents' intention, I will take merciless revenge on not only the rat but also conservative media in south Korea hell-bent on making rubbish."
					
					 Kang Man Il, a serviceman, said:
					
					 "I can hardly repress my surging resentment at the rat-like Myung Bak group of traitors.
					
					 We will shower shells on the group and its lackeys who insulted our KCU members as "children on markets" and "mere children knowing nothing about the world. Words do not work on such top-class imbeciles.
					
					 I am determined to tear and cut to pieces the group of traitors."
					
					 Cha Song Hui, a servicewoman, said:
					
					 "The rat-like Myung Bak group's vituperation is no more than its last-ditch effort.
					
					 Lee Myung Bak engaging himself only in doing wrongs and his lackeys, conservative media will meet a merciless strike from the revolutionary armed forces of Mt. Paektu."

articles.title: Servicepersons Raged at S. Korea's Smear Campaign
articles.content:
Servicepersons Raged at S. Korea's Smear Campaign
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Service personnel in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea hardly repress their resentment at the smear campaign kicked up by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors and conservative media of south Korea against the schoolchildren's celebrations now under way in Pyongyang.
					 Tong Tae San, a general officer of the Korean People's Army (KPA), told KCNA: 
					
					 "The campaign is tantamount to a high treason as it was aimed to hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK. 
					
					 The Lee group is playing down the celebrations for children as 'charades intentionally orchestrated', 'events for publicity stunt', 'act of imitating gesture and copying after Hitler' and "a political show like that staged by the Nazis to train the Juvenile Corps'.
					
					 Upon hearing about their treachery, all servicepersons are waiting for an order for southward advancement to wipe out the Lee group of traitors and conservative media."
					
					 Jo Song Chol, a KPA officer, said:
					
					 "Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un visited the Kyongsang Kindergarten some days ago, though he was busy guiding the building of a thriving nation, and had a photo session with kindergarteners.
					
					 This time he invited tens of thousands of schoolchildren to Pyongyang and took every possible measure for their celebrations.
					
					 But, the Lee group of traitors dared slander his noble outlook on posterity.
					
					 They are fascist maniacs, the present-day Nazis bringing an atmosphere of confrontation to even innocent children.
					
					 Chongwadae and buildings of all hacks have already been kept within our striking range.
					
					 If they challenge the ultimatum for retaliatory sacred war, they will meet a miserable end."

articles.title: KCNA Slams U.S. Foolish Moves to Justify Its Modernization of Nukes
articles.content:
KCNA Slams U.S. Foolish Moves to Justify Its Modernization of Nukes
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- U.S. President Obama, at the recent  graduation ceremony of a military academy of the U.S. Air Force, said that the U.S. will never remain a passive onlooker to the threat of north Korea and Iran to the whole world with nuclear programs.
					 This is a revelation of the U.S. foolish design to stir up atmosphere hostile to the DPRK and justify the modernization of its nuclear weapons under the pretext of non-existent "nuclear threat" from someone.
					
					 The U.S. modernization of nukes is, in essence, aimed to bolster up its capability to mount a preemptive nuclear attack on other countries.
					
					 The U.S. High-level Ad Hoc Investigation Committee in a report asserted that the U.S. should step up the modernization of the aging tactical nuclear weapons deployed in Europe.
					
					 Last year the U.S. decided to spend 4 billion dollars for the modernization of "B-61"-type nuclear bombs for replacing the aging nuclear bombs deployed in Europe.
					
					 According to this decision, the U.S. gives importance to the role of nukes and puts spurs to their modernization.
					
					 It is by no means fortuitous that the International Peace Institute in Stockholm said the U.S. is steadily improving the nuclear weapon system and will always remain a nuclear weapons state.
					
					 The U.S. is the main source and arch criminal which poses a nuclear threat to the world.
					
					 For their reactionary nature, gravity and hypocritical nature the above-said U.S. moves are strongly rebuffed and condemned by the people of many countries who wish to live in peace in the world free from nukes.
					
					 The "nuclear threat from north Korea" is the rhetoric let loose by the U.S. to justify the modernization of its nuclear weapons.
					
					 The DPRK had access to nuclear deterrent to defend the socialist system from the U.S. outrageous nuclear threat. However, the U.S. cites this as a threat to its "security" and "global peace." This is a mockery of the people of the DPRK and the international community.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will never allow the U.S. to use "nuclear threat" from someone as an excuse to bolster up its capability for preemptive nuclear strikes.
					
					 The U.S. should roll back its hostile policy toward independent countries and defuse its "nuclear threat" to them. Otherwise, they will spark off an arms race and increase the danger of a nuclear war not only in Northeast Asia but the rest of the world.

articles.title: "Coloring" Hysteria Is Not Way out for Lee Group: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
"Coloring" Hysteria Is Not Way Out for Lee Group: KCNA Commentary
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The "coloring" hysteria of the south Korean conservative group reached its height. 
					 A whirlwind of the campaign for "eliminating those following the north" is sweeping throughout south Korean society, to say nothing of the "National Assembly" and the military.
					
					 In the wake of traitor Lee Myung Bak's public appearance in which he grumbled "the forces following the north are problematic," the prosecution hurled repressive forces into an operation for investigating progressive figures.
					
					 The traitor cried out for preventing "the faction following the north and the Juche idea from entering the NA" in a bid to cook up a "NA resolution" for expelling the lawmakers from the Unified Progressive Party from it. He instigated the conservative media to make much ado that "the faction is going to wrest power".
					
					 The Lee group is also giving "brainwashing" to soldiers of the puppet army on the theme of "recognition of the existence of the faction of the leftist forces following the north."
					
					 The south Korean conservative group's such madcap "coloring campaign" is, in a nutshell, nothing but political terrorism aimed at ensuring the stay of the conservative forces in power. 
					
					 The group is now finding itself in an uncontrollable political and economic crisis, a product of its misrule, before "the presidential election." 
					
					 An unprecedentedly large number of candidates from the Unified Progressive Party and other progressive forces were elected to the "NA" in the election held in April. 
					
					 The conservative group feels much fretful over the fact that progressives' advance into the NA would be an impediment to its policy of confrontation and war against the north and help the tendency towards achieving reunification through an alliance with the north rapidly rise to create a situation unfavorable for the maintenance of the puppet ruling system and stay in power.
					
					 This prompted the group to come out again with "theory of coloring" as a stopgap measure to cope with the "call for judging Lee Myung Bak-Park Geun Hye" made by the people of different social standings and the pro-democracy and reform forces in a desperate bid to turn the situation favorable to it before the "presidential election." 
					
					 The "coloring" hysteria is the fit into which the group used to go whenever it comes to elections.
					
					 The successive conservative group including the clan of the "Saenuri Party" attempted to wriggle out of the political crisis by raising the shocking "theory of coloring", but it got them nowhere. They seem to have forgotten this.
					
					 The rat-like Lee Myung Bak group seeks to create an atmosphere of confrontation with fellow countrymen through its tricky "theory of coloring" in an effort to divide the public opinion and calm down the mounting call of different circles for judging the regime.
					
					 But the group has committed too many crimes to turn the situation favorable to it. 
					
					 Its "coloring" hysteria brings to light the true colors of the Lee group as a group of fascist gangsters who leave no means untried to meet its factional interests and ambition for power.
					
					 Despite its desperate efforts to prolong its remaining days through the long bankrupt "coloring operation" the Lee group forsaken by the nation has already been destined to go to ruin.
					
					 The "coloring" hysteria is by no means a way out for Lee Myung Bak.

articles.title: S. Korean Internet Newspaper Segye Ilbo Had Better Wag Its Tongue Properly: KCNA
articles.content:
S. Korean Internet Newspaper Segye Ilbo Had Better Wag Its Tongue Properly: KCNA
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The south Korean internet paper Segye Ilbo is behaving like a bad egg.
					 Upon receiving the open ultimatum issued by the General Staff of the Korean People's Army, fools of the paper dared say this or that about it after putting on shelf its malignant abuses. It is ridiculous, indeed. 
					
					 We would like to ask Segye Ilbo.
					
					 Can the paper explain the reason why it is so displeased with the celebration events of 20 000 children of the same nation?
					
					 There is a Korean adage "one speaks of funerals when the talk is of marriage." The paper raised the irrelevant issue of "defectors from the north" which cannot go unnoticed.
					
					 It is said that the number of defectors from south Korea who went overseas reached as many as 500 000. Doesn't the paper know about this fact or pretends not to know it?
					
					 All of the south Korean emigrants are those who left the south, cursing its society.
					
					 There are at least three million south Koreans who emigrated to foreign countries under the cloak of taking asylum, emigration, international marriage, etc. for more than four decades from 1962 to 2007. 
					
					 The paper should feel ashamed for going crazy, unable to discern directions. It must be mentally ill. 
					
					 The paper went the lengths of saying this or that about the nuclear and missile issues of the DPRK, not content with defaming the celebrations of the anniversary of the Children's Union.
					
					 It is common human relations to congratulate a neighbor on its happy event, to say nothing of that of a fellow countryman. How can the nation tolerate the mud-slinging made by the paper? 
					
					 The paper described the ultimatum as an attempt to "put a gag in the mouth". Is there anything to gain by gagging the paper ill-famed for inciting confrontation?
					
					 Great irony is that this paper is impertinently claiming that it is "one of media of the democratic world".
					
					 The virulent abuses made by the paper are nothing but a shriek made by those who are on pins and needles, feeling guilty of what they have done and fearful of retaliation.
					
					 The paper was taken aback by the firm will of the army of the DPRK to blow up the centers of those who are hurting the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK and doing harm to its ideology, social system and people.
					
					 The paper would be well advised to call a spade a spade.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group Deserves Punishment: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group Deserves Punishment: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea set in motion conservative media to launch a smear campaign against the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union and hurl mud at the schoolchildren of the DPRK.
					 It even hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK, describing them as "intentionally orchestrated" events. 
					
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 The Lee group painted the schoolchildren of the DPRK who would shoulder upon themselves the future of the country as "children on markets" who only think of money. This is malignant mud-slinging at the children, the future of the DPRK.
					
					 Absolutely unpardonable are the reckless remarks made by the group hurting again the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK over the celebrations.
					
					 The group of traitors should no longer be allowed to be at large as it defamed the supreme leadership of the DPRK and did harm to its ideology, social system and people. This is the unanimous will of all the service persons and people of the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK service personnel are ardently calling for an order to mete out punishment to them after having already targeted the dens of the most hideous provocateurs.
					
					 The Lee group would be well advised to look back on what it has done and make a final choice; to leave everything struck by the KPA or make an apology and opt to put the situation under control, though belatedly. Time is running out.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Editorially Marks 66th Anniversary of KCU
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Editorially Marks 66th Anniversary of KCU
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday dedicates an editorial to the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union.
					 The editorial says:
					
					 The celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the KCU now under way serve as a grand festival demonstrating throughout the world the Workers' Party of Korea's noble outlook on the younger generation and offer a happy opportunity of showing the proud picture of the schoolchildren in the DPRK growing up with nothing to desire more in the world, blessed with illustrious leaders.
					
					 Children of ordinary working people are now participating in the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the KCU in Pyongyang as delegates. They are spending happy days, enjoying all privileges. Such grand and significant events are unprecedented in the history of the DPRK.
					
					 The issue of bringing up the younger generation as successors to the revolutionary cause was successfully solved in the DPRK under the steersmanship of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, the editorial notes, and goes on:
					
					 Kim Il Sung established the glorious tradition of the children's movement in the days of the anti-Japanese struggle. He founded the KCU on this basis and devoted himself to the rising generations all his life.
					
					 The President's tradition of love for the younger generation was brought into full bloom in the era steered by Kim Jong Il. The epic on the noble love shown by them for the younger generation and future is now being successfully carried forward by the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Very deep is the trust of the party in the members of the KCU and very great is its expectation towards them. 
					
					 All the members of the KCU should fully prepare themselves as pillars of Songun Korea who steadfastly carry forward the revolutionary tradition started in Mt. Paektu, bearing deep in mind the oath they took before the banner of the KCU, the editorial concludes.

articles.title: "Saenuri Party" Urged to Drop Sycophancy towards U.S. and Confrontation with Compatriots
articles.content:
"Saenuri Party" Urged to Drop Sycophancy towards U.S. and Confrontation with Compatriots
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Power-greedy heavyweights of the south Korean "Saenuri Party" are vying with each other to make reckless remarks inciting sycophancy towards the U.S. and confrontation with fellow countrymen. 
					 This comes under fire by a bylined article of Rodong Sinmun Wednesday.
					
					 The "Saenuri Party" is a citadel of reactionary conservatives seeking sycophancy towards the U.S. and confrontation with compatriots. 
					
					 Dependence on outside forces is nothing but a despicable lever for the existence of the traitors as they have unhesitatingly sold off the nation's interests to outside forces, kowtowing to them.
					
					 The clan of the party has been raised by the U.S. in pro-Americanism. They have wallowed in luxury, having power and wealth in their hands.
					
					 Having handed the baton of sycophancy towards the U.S. by their predecessors, they that the U.S. forces present in south Korea "can by no means be outside forces." They have begged for their permanent presence while offering them a large amount of money for the upkeep of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces.
					
					 They are such fools that they paint the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces as "war deterrent" though they are the root cause of all misfortunes and sufferings of the south Koreans.
					
					 The traitors of the party are making desperate efforts to achieve the "unification of the social systems" keen on escalating the confrontation with fellow countrymen, opposed to the independence and unity of the nation. 
					
					 History and the situation taught more than once that sycophancy, treachery and confrontation with fellow countryman lead to a ruin.
					
					 The traitors are only fated to go to their graves as their predecessors did for going against the times and people's mind-set.

articles.title: S. Korean Organization Accuses Japan of Threatening Peace on Korean Peninsula
articles.content:
S. Korean Organization Accuses Japan of Threatening Peace on Korean Peninsula
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification of south Korea held a press conference on June 1 in Seoul to condemn Japan for hamstringing the efforts for the peace on the Korean Peninsula.
					 At the conference the speakers disclosed the plan of the Japanese Defense Ministry to deploy Aegis warship of the Maritime "Self-Defense Force" in waters close to the West Sea of Korea.
					
					 They branded the plan as an act of threatening the peace on the Korean Peninsula and escalating the military tension in Northeast Asia.
					
					 The deployment of Aegis warship in waters close to the West Sea of Korea would fuel Japan's burning ambition for reviving militarism, as it has always looked for an opportunity to advance toward the Korean Peninsula, they insisted.
					
					 Japan is revealing its militarist nature time and again, far from making apology and reflection on its past crimes including sexual slavery, distortion of history, etc., they said.

articles.title: Dong-A Ilbo Urged to Apologize for Telling Lie
articles.content:
Dong-A Ilbo Urged to Apologize for Telling Lie
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The "Religion, Civic and Public Measure Committee for Coping with Misinformation of Dong-A Ilbo on Late Spring Mun Ik Hwan School" of south Korea held a press conference outside the building of Dong-A Ilbo to denounce the conservative media for releasing misinformation on June 1.
					 Speakers at the conference accused Dong-A Ilbo of releasing misinformation about the Late Spring Mun Ik Hwan School that it let its young students participate in demos after giving them ideological education and their parents are opening internet websites to communicate with the north.
					
					 They recalled that the school in Kangjin County of South Jolla Province has deemed it a goal of education to achieve the peaceful national reunification true to the will of Rev. Mun Ik Hwan.
					
					 This being a hard fact, the conservative paper defamed even the inviolable seat of learning of children under the absurd pretext of ideology, they noted, adding that this is part of the coloring row kicked up before the "presidential election".
					
					 Querying Dong-A Ilbo if its hack journalists wrote such stories after visiting the school even once, they declared that organizations grouping people of different social standings and religionists would stage a massive protest unless the paper makes an apology and correction.

articles.title: Chinese Personage Wishes Korean People Bigger Success
articles.content:
Chinese Personage Wishes Korean People Bigger Success
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- I wish the Korean people greater success in their vigorous advance under the leadership of the dear respected Kim Jong Un, said Zhen Yan, vice-chairwoman and member of the Secretariat of the All-China Women's Federation on a visit to the DPRK, when interviewed by KCNA Wednesday.
					 The Korean people have successfully carried forward the revolutionary cause of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, true to the leadership of Kim Jong Un, she said, and went on:
					
					 I witnessed achievements made by the Korean people during my visits to several places.
					
					 Visiting the Pyongyang Hosiery Factory, I was deeply moved by the devotion made by Kim Jong Il to the production of quality hosiery of various kinds suited to the tastes of the people.
					
					 What was also impressive was the new appearance of Pyongyang that has changed beyond imagination.
					
					 Modern skyscrapers were built in Pyongyang where the greening has been stepped up. Passers-by seem to be full of joy and optimism.
					
					 The delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union spend happy and delightful days in Pyongyang under the loving care shown by Kim Jong Un, who regards children as kings of the country.
					
					 He also projects women as flowers of the times.
					
					 I heard that he watched the concert "The Women Are Flowers" given by the Unhasu Orchestra to mark the March 8 International Women's Day.
					
					 I think that this is his great trust in women.
					
					 The Korean women are devoting their wisdom and enthusiasm at different posts with one mind to render devoted services for the country and people.
					
					 I will work hard to boost exchange and cooperation between women's organizations of the two countries in the future.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Praised by Congolese Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Praised by Congolese Party Leader
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- Otete Gaston Mboyo, deputy general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Democratic Congo and chairman of the Democratic Congo-Korea Friendship and Solidarity Association, issued a statement on May 23 after receiving the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche."
					 The work, published on April 6, reflects the strong sense of moral obligation and firm will of the supreme leader Kim Jong Un to victoriously advance generation after generation the Korean revolution which started in Mt. Paektu and has developed by dint of Songun, holding President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal leaders of the Workers' Party of Korea, he noted, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK could turn into an invincible power and a fortress of socialism under the leadership of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It is most important for providing a guarantee for the prosperity of the generations to come of the Korean nation and the ultimate victory of the cause of Juche to accelerate the building of a thriving socialist nation as required by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, holding Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il in high esteem as the eternal leaders of the WPK.
					
					 He expressed undisputed sympathy with the profound ideas in the work of Kim Jong Un and sincerely wished the Korean people great successes in the efforts to build a thriving socialist nation and achieve the reunification of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Carried by Congolese, Indian Papers
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Carried by Congolese, Indian Papers
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The Congolese paper L'Avenir on May 24 carried the main content of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirements for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation".
					 The work, published on April 27, 2012, clarifies the undying exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in land management and indicates the general orientation and tasks for face-lifting the country's land as befitting a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 The gist of his work "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche" was carried by the Indian paper Indian and World Event on May 30.
					
					 The work, published on April 6, 2012, clarifies that it is a principled requirement for the victorious advance of the Korean revolution to hold Kim Jong Il in high esteem as eternal general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea. It indicates the tasks for steadily developing the WPK into the glorious party of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Carried by Italian Organization in Its Bulletin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Carried by Italian Organization in Its Bulletin
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The Group of Dialectical Materialists of Italy on May 29 carried in its bulletin the dear respected Kim Jong Un's works "Let Us Hold Great Comrade Kim Jong Il in High Esteem as General Secretary of Our Party Forever and Successfully Accomplish the Revolutionary Cause of Juche" and "Let's Dynamically Struggle for a Final Victory, Holding Aloft the Banner of Songun."

articles.title: Bangladeshi Organization Supports June 15 North-South Joint Declaration
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Organization Supports June 15 North-South Joint Declaration
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The Bangladesh Institute of the Juche Idea released a bulletin on May 30 to mark the 12th anniversary of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration.
					 The bulletin said that the adoption of the joint declaration in Pyongyang, the first of its kind since the division of Korea, was an event to be specially recorded as it marked an occasion of landmark turn in the movement for Korea's reunification.
					
					 It stressed that the June 15 joint declaration is a cornerstone for developing the inter-Korean relations and a great programme for the reunification of Korea as it clarified the ideological basis, main principles and ways for achieving national reconciliation, unity and reunification.
					
					 The basic spirit of the joint declaration is to solve the issue of reunification by concerted efforts of the Koreans free from any outside interference, it noted.
					
					 The bulletin stressed that the international community hopes that the Korean nation would achieve the independent and peaceful reunification of the country without fail under the banner of the joint declaration.

articles.title: S. Korea's Lee Myung Bak Regime Lambasted
articles.content:
S. Korea's Lee Myung Bak Regime Lambasted
 Pyongyang, June 6 (KCNA) -- The General Staff of the Korean People's Army sent an open ultimatum to the south Korean group of traitors on June 4.
					 In this regard, KCNA had an interview with Ko Yong Guk, a department head at Kim Il Sung University who is a media expert.
					
					 Question: The ultimatum pointed out that the situation is getting more serious due to the smear campaign launched by the Lee Myung Bak group of traitors and conservative media of south Korea. How do you think about it?
					
					 Answer: "Impartiality and objectivity of media" are loudly advertised in capitalist society like south Korea.
					
					 But this is no more than a deception to mislead public opinion.
					
					 We can know well it through the petty act of south Korea's conservative media like Chosun Ilbo, Choongang Ilbo, "A Channel" of Dong-A Ilbo, KBS, and CBS. Those ultra-right media let loose a spate of vituperations against the celebrations of the 66th birthday of the Korean Children's Union now under way in Pyongyang, daring hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 They abused the celebrations as "charades intentionally orchestrated" by the DPRK supreme leadership, "events for publicity stunt," "events to win popularity" and "events to curry favor with them."
					
					 Such evil deed committed by the rat-like Lee Myung Bak group of traitors and its conservative media revealed their anti-national colors.
					
					 The DPRK servicepersons and civilians will not remain an onlooker to their inhuman remarks describing the schoolchildren of the DPRK as "children on markets" and "mere children knowing nothing about the world."
					
					 The rat-like Lee group and its conservative media, hell bent on slinging mud at the celebrations irrelative to north-south relations, should clearly know that their doom is sealed.

articles.title: Russian President Accuses West of Moves to Establish MD in Europe
articles.content:
Russian President Accuses West of Moves to Establish MD in Europe
 Moscow, June 5 (KCNA) -- Russian President Vladimir Putin in a press conference on June 1 accused the West of its moves to establish missile defense system (MD) in Europe.
					 He denounced the West for continuously adopting unilateral decisions related to MD without taking Russia's stand and its interests in security into consideration.
					
					 Russia needs military and technological guarantee that MD in Europe does not go against it, he said, adding that such assurances should be fixed in documents of legal obligation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un pronuncia discurso de felicitacion en acto nacional de ONC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un pronuncia discurso de felicitacion en acto nacional de ONC
Pyongyang, 6 de junio (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Primer Secretario del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Primer Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, pronuncio la palabra de felicitacion en el acto nacional de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea (ONC). 
					El Maximo Dirigente felicito calidamente a los delegados y miembros de la ONC de todo el pais, que acogen el 6 de junio, dia de fundacion de la organizacion, bajo la gran atencion y bendicion del partido y el pueblo. 
					
					Saludo cordialmente tambien a los maestros y padres de todo el pais que se esfuerzan mucho por criar bien a los ninos.
					
					El 6 de junio es la fiesta de la ONC, y al mismo tiempo, una efemeride preciosa de nuestro partido y todo el pueblo coreano, dijo. 
					
					En este mundo, no hay otros ninos como los nuestros de la ONC que en el numero de millones, estan unidos compactamente en una organizacion poniendose panoletas rojas y se forman como futuros protagonistas, destaco. 
					
					Para el PTC y la RPDC, los adorados miembros de la ONC son tesoros mas valiosos que los montones de oro y plata y simbolos de toda la esperanza y el futuro, puntualizo.
					
					Kim Jong Un se refirio a muchos trabajos utiles realizados por los fidedignos miembros de la ONC en aras de la patria y el pueblo. 
					
					El partido y el pueblo estan muy contentos y orgullosos de contar con la excelente ONC y le espera un futuro esplendido a la Corea del Songun porque hay ese contingente de millones de ninos revolucionarios, recalco. 
					
					Subrayo que la ONC llego a conocerse hoy en el mundo como poderosa entidad infantil de los continuadores de la revolucion gracias al Generalisimo Kim Il Sung y al Generalisimo        Kim Jong Il quienes tenian de connatural el noble amor a las generaciones venideras y al futuro,.
					
					Prosiguio que en este mundo no hay otros grandes padres como esos Generalisimos, quienes presentaron el amor a las generaciones venideras como asunto mas importante del partido y el Estado llamando a los ninos como reyes del pais y dedicaron todo lo suyo para los escolares. 
					
					El PTC tiene la meta de legar a los miembros de la ONC un Estado prospero socialista mas ventajoso del mundo, dijo y agrego que la Corea prospera del futuro sera el pais mas poderoso, feliz y armonioso del mundo.
					
					Instruyendo que los miembros de la ONC deben apoyar ese pais grandioso y construirlo mejor, indico las tareas correspondientes. 
					
					Los miembros de la ONC deben aprender los gloriosos periodos de infancia de los Generalisimos Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il como los girasoles teniendo siempre presente la gran confianza y beneficios dispensados por ellos, y continuar firmemente el linaje de la revolucion enarbolando las banderas con efigies de esos grandes hombres, seguidas de la bandera de la ONC. 
					
					Les hace falta prepararse como verdaderos revolucionarios ninos y vanguardias infantiles de la era del Songun que sepan defender a costa de la vida al partido como los heroes del Cuerpo Infantil Antijapones y los ninos guerrilleros del periodo de la Guerra de Liberacion de la Patria, y avanzar directo por la senda indicada por el partido. 
					
					Deben prepararse tambien como revolucionarios competentes y pilares de la Corea prospera que tengan ricos conocimientos, nobles virtudes y buena salud. 
					
					Es preciso aprender con el creciente afan sin pasar inutilmente ni un rato libre bajo la consigna de "Aprendamos por la Corea prospera". 
					
					Deben hacerse ejemplares en estudiar, observar la moralidad socialista, amar en todo momento la organizacion, el colectivo y a los companeros, respetar a los maestros y los mayores, practicar al deporte y realizar trabajos provechosos con el alma patriotica.
					
					Han de participar sincera y voluntariamente en la vida organizativa de la ONC teniendo presente que el honor de militante del partido y la medalla de la estrella de oro del heroe tienen su origen en la panoleta roja y la insignia de la ONC.
					
					En la parte final de su discurso, Kim Jong Un dijo que hoy dia, el partido deposita gran esperanza en los instructores de la ONC y los de los grupos filiales de la misma organizacion.
					
					Expreso la esperanza de que ellos sean raices y maestros genuinos que cuiden y amen a los miembros de la ONC con el afecto de padres, desarrollen sus talentos y los guien a los caminos correctos. 
					
					El PTC y el gobierno de la RPDC tomaran como asuntos mas importantes del partido y el Estado las labores para las nuevas generaciones, en fiel acato al noble proposito del Generalisimo Kim Il Sung y el Generalisimo Kim Jong Il de amar a las generaciones venideras, y haran todo lo posible por formar a los preciosos miembros de la ONC como futuros trabajadores de la Corea del Songun mas felices y excelentes en este mundo, concluyo.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un presencia concierto por 66o aniversario de fundacion de ONC
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un presencia concierto por 66o aniversario de fundacion de ONC
Pyongyang, 6 de junio (ACNC) -- Tuvo lugar solemnemente el dia 6 en esta capital el concierto de la Orquesta Unhasu "!Amen el futuro!", dedicado al 66o aniversario de la fundacion de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea.
					Salio al palco el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un junto con los miembros ejemplares de la ONC.
					
					El felicito y saludo cordialmente a los delegados a los festejos del 6 de junio, dia de fundacion de la ONC.
					
					Disfrutaron el espectaculo junto con el los cuadros direcivos del partido, el Estado y el ejercito como Kim Yong Nam, Choe Yong Rim, Choe Ryong Hae y Ri Yong Ho, los funcionarios de las instituciones del partido y las fuerzas armadas y de la Union de la Juventud Socialista Kim Il Sung y los delegados a los festejos del 66o aniversario de la ONC.
					
					En la escena del concierto, iniciado con la interpretacion del Himno Nacional, se presentaron el sexteto mixto y coro "Sois el futuro de la patria",  el solo masculino y coro "Camino al monte Paektu", el coro "Vivimos en el regazo del Lider", el solo femenino y coro "Es calido el amor de la patria" y otras piezas.
					
					Los ejecutantes elogiaron altamente las imperecederas hazanas del Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il quienes con la noble concepcion de las generaciones venideras, prepararon la gloriosa tradicion del autoctono movimiento infantil y crearon la historia en que los ninos son felices en todo como reyes del pais.
					
					Tambien se llevaron a la escena el trio femenino y coro infantil de la obra clasica "Cancion de Corea", el coro infantil "Cancion de guerrilla infantil", el trio femenino "Amor del General", el coro femenino y coro "Nuestro padre" y otras piezas interpretadas por los artistas de Unhasu con los ninos escolares, las cuales fomentaron el ambiente de fiesta.
					
					El concierto llego al climax con el epilogo compuesto de coro infantil "Aprendamos para Corea", poesia y cancion "!Amen el futuro!" y coro "Marcha de la Organizacion de Ninos".
					
					Terminado el concierto, Kim Jong Un respondio a las aclamaciones de ejecutantes y espectadores y les felicito por la exitosa funcion.
					
					El presente concierto de Unhasu hizo constar a todos la verdad de que sera siempre maravilloso el futuro de la Corea de Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il gracias al Maximo Dirigente quien escribe la nueva historia de aprecio a las generaciones venideras bajo la consigna "!Amen el futuro!"

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de condolencias al presidente nigeriano
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam envia mensaje de condolencias al presidente nigeriano
Pyongyang, 6 de junio (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 6 un mensaje de condolencias al presidente de la Republica Federal de Nigeria, Goodluck Ebele Jonathan, por las perdidas humanas ocasionadas por caida de un avion de pasajeros en este pais africano.
					En su misiva, el remitente expresa profunda compasion y condolencias al destinatario, y por su conducto, a las victimas y sus familiares.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim visita la residencia de los delegados infantiles
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim visita la residencia de los delegados infantiles
Pyongyang, 6 de junio (ACNC) -- Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y primer ministro del Consejo de Ministros de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, visito el dia 5 la residencia de los delegados a los festejos del 66o aniversario de la fundacion de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea.
					Recorriendo el dormitorio, bano, cuarto de aseo, comedor y otros puntos, Choe hizo conocimiento de las condiciones de vida de los delegados.
					
					Subrayo la necesidad de atender con amor paternal a los integrantes ejemplares de la ONC que llegaron a Pyongyang como delegados bajo la atencion especial del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un.
					
					De acuerdo con el proposito del Maximo Dirigente que llamo a los delegados de la ONC de todo el pais al gran festival en homenaje al aniversario 66 de esta organizacion infantil, debemos prestar profunda atencion al aseguramiento del confort de vida para ellos, inclusive las condiciones de hospedaje, resalto.

articles.title: Minju Joson aboga por sentenciar a banda de traidor Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Minju Joson aboga por sentenciar a banda de traidor Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 6 de junio (ACNC) -- Movilizando los medios de prensa conservadores, la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak desprestigia las festividades por el 66o aniversario de la fundacion de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea y difama a los ninos escolares y hasta a la Direccion Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea describiendolas de "episodios orquestados intencionalmente".
					En su comentario individual insertado este miercoles, el periodico Minju Joson lo califica de malvada difamacion y calumnio a los ninos escolares que crecen como fidedignos trabajadores encargados del porvenir del pais y prosigue:
					
					Para colmo, es imperdonable la demagogia de esta pandilla que volvio a denigrar la maxima dignidad de la RPDC en cuanto a las presentes actividades.
					
					Jamas debemos dejar intacta a la banda traidora que deshonra nuestra maxima dignidad y perjudica a nuestra idea, regimen y pueblo. Esta es la unanime voluntad de nuestro ejercito y pueblo coreanos.
					
					Los oficiales y soldados de las fuerzas terrestres, aereas y navales del Ejercito Popular de Corea solicitan que se de la orden de atacar las madrigueras de los provocadores.
					
					Pasando revista a sus crimenes cometidos, la banda del traidor Lee debe tomar la ultima opcion ante la disyuntiva de exponer todo lo suyo al ataque de nuestro ejercito o remediar la situacion pidiendo disculpas aunque sea tarde.
					
					El tiempo no es indefinido.

articles.title: ACNC revela intento de EE.UU. de racionalizar modernizacion de armas
articles.content:
ACNC revela intento de EE.UU. de racionalizar modernizacion de armas
Pyongyang, 6 de junio (ACNC) -- En la reciente ceremonia de graduacion de la escuela de cadetes de fuerzas navales de Estados Unidos, el presidente norteamericano Obama dijo que "no estara con los brazos cruzados ante la amenaza del Norte de Corea e Iran a todo el mundo con sus planes nucleares".
					Es un absurdo intento para racionalizar sus maniobras tendentes a modernizar las armas nucleares al crear el ambiente hostil contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea bajo el pretexto de la inexistente "amenaza nuclear" de esta.
					
					En su esencia, tales maniobras son para fortalecer mas la capacidad de ataque preventivo nuclear a otros paises.
					
					En su informe del comite de averiguacion especial de alto rango, el imperio insiste en la necesidad de modernizar las armas nucleares tacticas ubicadas hace mucho tiempo en Europa.
					
					El ano pasado, decidio invertir 4 mil millones de US$ para modernizar las bombas tipo "B-61" que se sustituiran a las bombas nucleares viejas colocadas en los paises europeos.
					
					Por tal motivo, EE.UU. presta mas que nunca la importancia al papel de las armas nucleares y da espuela a su modernizacion.
					
					Hace poco, el Instituto Internacional de la Paz en Estocolmo revelo que EE.UU. sigue mejorando el sistema de arma nuclear y quedara perpetuamente como pais poseedor de armas nucleares.
					
					EE.UU. es  caudillo que acarrea la amenaza nuclear a todo el mundo.
					
					Por el caracter reaccionario, gravedad y falsedad, las maniobras de EE.UU. son repudiadas rotundamente por los pueblos de numerosos paises que aspiran a vivir pacificamente en un mundo sin armas nucleares.
					
					Por tal motivo, para racionalizar sus maniobras el imperio presenta la teoria de la "amenaza nuclear del Norte de Corea".
					
					Describir como amenaza a su "seguridad" y la "paz internacional" la posesion de la fuerza disuasiva nuclear optada por la RPDC para defender su regimen socialista de la cruel amenaza nuclear de EE.UU. es una burla al pueblo de la RPDC y la sociedad internacional.
					
					El ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC no perdonaran jamas las maniobras de EE.UU. que utiliza como escudo la "amenaza nuclear" de alguien para intensificar la capacidad de ataque preventivo nuclear.
					
					Si el imperio no abandona la politica hostil y la "amenaza nuclear" a los paises independientes, esto producira la carrera armamentista en la region Nordeste de Asia y el resto del mundo y la amenaza de guerra nuclear.

articles.title: ACNC refuta reportes de Segye Ilbo sobre ultimatum del EPC
articles.content:
ACNC refuta reportes de Segye Ilbo sobre ultimatum del EPC
Pyongyang, 6 de junio (ACNC) -- Los plumiferos del periodico online surcoreano Segye Ilbo estan buscando reyerta en cuanto al recien publicado ultimatum abierto del Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Corea sin hacer referencia alguna a sus tremendas maldades.
					Quisieramos preguntar a Segye Ilbo por que esta tan disgustado de los festejos de 20 mil ninos de la connacional Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Ese rotativo saco absurdamente esta vez el tema de los "fugitivos norcoreanos".
					
					Otra vez le preguntamos si no sabe o se hace el desentendido del exodo al extranjero de los surcoreanos cuyo numero llega a mas de medio millon.
					
					Los emigrantes surcoreanos son los "fugitivos" que salieron del pais maldiciendo la sociedad surcoreana.
					
					Durante mas de 4 decadas entre 1962 y 2007, sobrepaso 3 millones el numero de emigrantes surcoreanos por diferentes motivos como exilio, emigracion y matrimonio internacional.
					
					Es una realidad realmente vergonzosa.
					
					Al cabo de censurar los festejos de la Organizacion de Ninos de Corea, Segye Ilbo difunde versiones malintencionadas hasta del arma nuclear y el misil de la RPDC.
					
					En particular, describe el ultimatum del EPC como intento de "amordazar".
					
					Dejamos en claro que no tendremos nada que ganar con silenciar a ese "medio del mundo democratico", habituado a los reportes en busca de enfrentamiento fratricida con la RPDC.
					
					Sus informaciones malintencionadas son reflejos de la culpabilidad y la inquietud.
					
					Es que los plumiferos de ese medio venal se quedaron consternados ante la ferrea voluntad del EPC de no perdonar la madriguera de los provocadores que calumnian la maxima dignidad, la idea, el regimen y el pueblo de la RPDC.
					
					Hay que informar en estricto apego a la realidad sin mezclarla con su mal genio, esto es el consejo que le damos a Segye Ilbo.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia maniobras conflictivas de "Partido Saenuri"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia maniobras  conflictivas  de "Partido Saenuri"
Pyongyang, 6 de junio (ACNC) -- En un articulo individual difundido este miercoles, el diario Rodong Sinmun senala que los compinches del "Partido Saenuri" del Sur de Corea inculcan el servilismo a Estados Unidos y la confrontacion fratricida para el poder, y continua:
					El "Partido Saenuri" es el foco de las fuerzas conservadoras reaccionarias que viven con el servilismo proyanqui y la confrontacion fratricida.
					
					La dependencia de las fuerzas extranjeras es el metodo de existencia de los vendepatrias que venden sin titubeo los intereses de la nacion.
					
					La banda de este partido empapada de la idea proyanqui ocupo el poder y bienes a precios de la adulacion y obediencia a EE.UU. y ha venido viviendo en la opulencia.
					
					Tales traidores, que heredaron el espiritu proyanqui de sus antepasados, insisten en que los efectivos agresivos norteamericanos ocupantes del Sur de Corea "no pueden ser las fuerzas extranjeras" y les pedian la permanencia eterna dandoles hasta suma cantidad de impuesto de los habitantes.
					
					Esta banda describe el ejercito agresivo norteamericano, causa raigal de todas desgracias y dolores de los habitantes surcoreanos como "disuasivo de guerra".
					
					Los traidores del "Partido Saenuri" se desesperan para realizar la "unificacion de regimenes" negando la independencia y la unidad de la nacion y entregandose a la confrontacion fratricida.
					
					La historia y la realidad demostraron una vez mas que el servilismo a grandes potencias y la confrontacion fratricida son el camino de arruinamiento.
					
					Por lo tanto, a la horda del "Partido Saenuri" le tocara solo la tumba.
